website_summaries.verdict: Sony's 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 Zoom Lens is sharp through most of its zoom range, but suffers from distortion and is noticeably soft at its telephoto extreme.

customer_reviews.title: This is a NICE lens
customer_reviews.text: I used this to photograph a friend's wedding. I am very happy that I bought it. The photos came out great and the zoom range (18-135) was perfect. Not too skimpy, not too large. Just right. The lens is substantial. Does not have that "cheap" feeling that some other lenses (including some SONY models) have. To top it off, it was MADE in JAPAN - Bravo! I think Japanese optics are the best. I don't know if all copies of this model are made in the same factory, but mine was made in Japan. I recommend getting a 62mm UV filter to protect the front of this valuable investment.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: thinking about reselling
customer_reviews.text: The lens has a nice feel. Sam II auto focus is still a little noisy and wants to hunt unless in bright sunlight. Thought it would be sharper than my Sigma 18-250 HSM but it is not. Will stick with the Sigma as the IQ is as good as the sony 18-135, it has more range and the auto focus is much better,faster and pretty quiet. But the 18-135 is a good lens if you don't have any thing other than a OEM 18-55
customer_reviews.author: Joyce E. Stoesser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the flexibility to photograph a friend's wedding. The motor focuses quickly and quietly. The depth of field was surprisingly much better than I expected. The largest aperture allowed nice portraits with the background out of focus. Overall, the photos were a hit with the bride and groom, and the lens is a keeper - now a favorite staple with wide range of telephoto, but it travels next to my 50mm 1.4f for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Sharp pictures.
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like a native lens. This lens is awesome. It's sharp clear autofocus is pretty decent. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Patty B.

customer_reviews.title: All Round Solid Lens
customer_reviews.text: A must a have all round lens. Everything about this lens is 'decent'. It is well balanced on the camera (A65/A77). I would have preferred the costlier 16-50/f2.8 but then 135 range (7.5x) on SAL18135 makes it irresistable. I use it for landscapes, as well as outdoor portraiture.
customer_reviews.author: Anuran

customer_reviews.title: Ideal  zoom range yet light enough to carry
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to travel light and this fits the bill perfect. If the lens was any faster the weight would be to much for carry all day. I carry a lightweight monopod and can use with my a55 low shutter speeds. I do outdoor most of the time and hike or bike around its nice to carry. Its smooth and quick to focus. No technical analysis but my photos are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jimhuddle

customer_reviews.title: Damn good lens.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used in Mint Condition for about half the price and must say I'm beyond pleased with this lens. Made in Japan (amazing optics) Very good focal length, SAM(Smooth Autofocus Motor) Very silent compared to my other lenses such as the 50mm f1.8 Metal Mount, rubber focus ring and zoom ring. I shoot professional and this lens with my a77 works amazing. The quality in the photos is astonishing. I would definitely recommend this lens. Worth ever penny!
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my a57 instead of the kit lens and I REALLY like it. Nice range of focal length, decent (not great, but decent) speed, focuses quickly and accurately, images are sharp, nice bokeh at the wide apertures. When I'm traveling light, this is the only lens I carry.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Carriker II

customer_reviews.title: Lens moderately priced
customer_reviews.text: One of Sony's better lenses in the range of 50-200mm lenses for the a mount camera. A real shame that camera has been replaced by the e mount camera.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Cooko

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago for my Sony a57. Very convenient for close and long ranges without changing lenses. Works well indoors at school events where there is some lighting. Videos well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4eva

customer_reviews.title: APS-C lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, APS-C, If you have a full frame camera it will have major tunnel vision. Quick auto focus.
customer_reviews.author: Zerksi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lens for general use
customer_reviews.text: If you are upgrading from a kit lens or looking for a lens better suited to the wide array of shots traveling can present, this is an excellent choice. The lens is built solid, has a nice weight to it, and zooms smoothly. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: It's a must have
customer_reviews.text: This lens has become my best friend Awsome Awsome quality! If you are looking for something where zoom isn't so much you priority but just enough, and that does great portraits without switching lens constantly. This is the lens for you worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great focal length
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little lens, good bokeh at the long end, perfect match to the little a65 when I don't want to lug ZA and a99. This replace the 18-250 and 16-80ZA, This lens along with the fantastic little 35/1.8 and a65 is my lightweight kit.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne N. Voiselle

customer_reviews.title: Super lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is fantastic. Does everything I wanted it for. Great reach. This is now my every day lens that stays on the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lendawg

customer_reviews.title: Good quality kit lens.
customer_reviews.text: I think it would be unfair to give it less than 5 stars. To be fair, there is absolutely nothing wrong with the lens that I can tell. To 95% of the people shooting with it, you wouldn't know the difference between this and a more expensive lens. The pictures are great, the focusing is quiet and it isn't too heavy. For the price range it is a 5. This review is based on the value and quality compared to the price. If it were a lot more expensive, it might be a 4 because you could get better options for the money. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: Good  every day lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens pretty much does everything i need it to do for every day use taking snap shots and job site pics.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley williams

customer_reviews.title: Terrific lens
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this lens. I love the zoom range, it is great for primary, walking around lens. The lock switch to avoid gravity creep extension is nice feature. Nice size & weight also.
customer_reviews.author: George. Zachotina

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This lens had very few reviews as it is quite new. I bought it for its focal range, and Sonys track record with optics, for use on my A77. Unfortunately, this lens is very soft at mid and long telephoto ranges. It does give relatively sharp images at wider angles, and when taking images of things within 40 to 50 feet. I ended up getting rid of it, and purchasing two mid 80s Minolta lenses. The Minolta lenses are superb, and give tack sharp images across the frame.
customer_reviews.author: fototker

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Sony lens is ok but, wanted something f2.8 my falt but here,s the not a happy camper,try to get the seller to talk to but no help there came in white box with little wrap.I would have paid more a lot more if sell would work with me didn,t happen.So guess what called one of the other dealers and got the sony 70-200mm f2.8 for a new one no tax no shipping for under 2000.00 with a nice sony case and thy gave free 77mm UV haze filter has well happy happy camper now but still got the 18-135 setting in the box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Northsman

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for it's price
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy my lens on Amazon. Lens takes good pictures, At 18mm it has a few problems with the edges. From 20 to 135 minimal distortion using jpeg's. Raw pictures doesn't get corrected. The biggest problem with the lens is it's lack of weather sealing. Thats were Sony cut costs. If you an keep it dry and dust free this lens makes a good travel lens.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens for different circumstances
customer_reviews.text: I have had this lens since 2013. Very good lens for different circumstances, speedo and reliable, good optics.
customer_reviews.author: Luchy Placencia

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful lens!
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens as part of a kit with the Sony A57 camera. It is a perfect size, not too big or heavy, with excellent optics. Don't believe the one bad review about this lens on here, (perhaps they got a rare bad copy??) this thing takes great images, nice colors, good bokeh, and is an all around good performer. Yes the reach is limited on the telephoto end, but for that I have a dedicated 75-300. As a walk around or travel lens, this one is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PhotoArtist

customer_reviews.title: Nice Lens
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the ease of use and convenience beat the other drawbacks of a lens. With the 18-135, you get a reasonably good zoom range that makes it an ideal walk around lens. I use this lens in combination with my A57. The pictures are great so far, but they are not as sharp as I'd like them to be. The lens quality is nice and it doesn't feel cheap at all. Focus ring is smooth, but the zoom ring felt a little stiff to me while going from 18mm to a higher focal length. This is a decent lens that gets the job done. Pair this with the 50mm 1.8 and you got yourself lenses for every occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Akash

customer_reviews.title: The Sony 18-135 is a decent lens for general photography
customer_reviews.text: I have used this lens for thousands of sharp colorful shots, the only problem I have is it vignettes in the corners, other then that no complaints! I have sold photos taken with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rossi

product_meta.title: Sony SAL18135 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 Zoom Lens
product_meta.description:
A-mount DT 18-135mm F3.5-5.6 SAM

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



DT 18-135MM F3.5-5.6 SAM ZOOM LENS
This lightweight lens offers the dual advantages of a very useful 18-135mm zoom range and easy portability. Featuring an outstanding optical design that includes aspheric lenses and ED glass for stellar resolution, plus an in-lens motor that maximizes autofocus performance for high-speed continuous still shooting as well as movies. Manual focus is smooth and easy as well.

TECHNOLOGY
ED (EXTRA-LOW DISPERSION) GLASS
As focal lengths get longer, lenses built with conventional optical glass have difficulties with chromatic aberration, and as a result images suffer from lower contrast, lower color quality, and lower resolution. ED glass dramatically reduces chromatic aberration at telephoto ranges, and provides superior contrast across the entire image, even at large aperture settings. Super ED glass provides enhanced compensation for chromatic aberration.

ASPHERICAL LENS ELEMENTS
Aspherical lens design dramatically reduces spherical aberration while also reducing lens size and weight. Spherical aberration is a slight misalignment of the light rays projected on the image plane. This is caused by differences in refraction at different points on conventional spherical lenses which degrade image quality in large-aperture lenses. Specially shaped “aspherical” elements near the diaphragm restore alignment of light rays at the image plane, maintaining high sharpness and contrast even at maximum aperture and can also be used at other points in the optical path to reduce distortion. Well-designed aspherical elements can reduce the total number of elements required in the lens, thus reducing overall size and weight. Advanced Aspherical (AA) elements are an evolved variant, featuring an extremely high thickness ratio between the center and periphery. AA elements are exceedingly difficult to produce, relying on the most advanced molding technology to consistently and precisely achieve the required shape and surface accuracy, resulting in significantly improved image accuracy and quality.

DISTANCE ENCODER
The distance encoder plays an integral part in ADI flash metering, which delivers high precision flash metering that is unaffected by the reflectance of subjects or backgrounds. The distance encoder is a lens component that directly detects the position of the focusing mechanism, and sends a signal to the CPU in order to measure distance to the subject. During flash photography, this data is very useful in calculating how much flash output is appropriate to the scene.

SAM (SMOOTH AUTOFOCUS MOTOR)
Rather than using the focus drive motor in the camera body, SAM lenses feature an autofocus motor built into to the lens itself that directly drives the focusing element group. Since the built-in motor directly rotates the focus mechanism, operation is significantly smoother and quieter than conventional coupled autofocus drive systems.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
INTERNAL FOCUSING
Only the middle groups of the optical system move to achieve focus, so the overall length of the lens does not change. Other important benefits include fast autofocusing and a short minimum focusing distance. Also, the filter thread at the front of the lens does not rotate, which is convenient if you’re using a polarizing filter.
